Resolve list of filter states

resolve_state.Rd

Resolves the state values for FilterState$set_state(), which accepts only a list with selected,keep_na and keep_inf fields. In case of the default_filter function, it returns NULL as during the initialization of FilterState values are set to default.

Usage

resolve_state(x)

# S3 method for default
resolve_state(x)

# S3 method for default_filter
resolve_state(x, filter_state)

# S3 method for list
resolve_state(x)

Arguments

x

(list,vector)
values of the variable used in filter. Depending on the FilterState type list must contain these fields:

  • selected defines initial selection. See notes for more details

  • keep_na (logical) defines whether to keep or remove NA values

  • keep_inf (logical) defines whether to keep or remove Inf values

If vector is provided then keep_na and keep_inf can be specified adding NA and Inf to the selection vector.

Value

list containing selected, keep_na and keep_inf

Note

The value of the x$selected needs to be modified according to the type of the passed filter_state.

See also

  • LogicalFilterState

  • ChoicesFilterState

  • RangeFilterState

  • DateFilterState

  • DatetimeFilterState

Examples

teal.slice:::resolve_state(list(c(1, 2), keep_na = FALSE, keep_inf = TRUE))
#> $selected
#> [1] 1 2
#> 
#> $keep_na
#> [1] FALSE
#> 
#> $keep_inf
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
teal.slice:::resolve_state(c(1, 2, Inf))
#> $selected
#> [1] 1 2
#> 
#> $keep_inf
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
teal.slice:::resolve_state(list())
#> list()

On this page

teal.slice is a part of the NEST and pharmaverse.
